title: The new Scotch-jigg: or, The bonny cravat Johnny wooed Jenny to tye his cravat; but Jenny perceiving what he would be at, with delayes put him off, till she found out his mind; and then afterwards she proved more kind: at length both parties were well agreed, and went to the kirck to be wed with all speed. Tune of, Jenny come tye my, &c.
publicationStmtPublisher: printed for W. Thackeray, T. Passenger, and W. Whiwood,
